channel.title: MoparScape Server Help FAQ [Please read Before Posting]
channel.description:
[center][b] As of this date [Nov. 23, 2010], most of the FAQ is from The_Soul so many thanks to him. This topic will be updated much more when different frequent questions have been asked in this Server Help section. The purpose of this is to stop users from repeating questions that have been answered many times before and instead of them waiting for an answer, they could just look here for the answer. [/b][/center]
[hr]
[center][size=15pt][b][u]Table of Contents[/u][/b][/size][/center]
[hr]
[center][iurl=#one]Where can I learn Java?[/iurl] [iurl=#two]How do I start my own private server?[/iurl] [iurl=#three]How do I port forward?[/iurl] [iurl=#four]Where do I download java?[/iurl] [iurl=#five]When I try to compile my Java files, the compiler prints ''javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command'. How do I fix this?[/iurl] [iurl=#six]Where can I find *name here*?[/iurl] [iurl=#seven]How do I change my player rights?[/iurl] [iurl=#eight]What are the most common player rights?[/iurl] [iurl=#nine]I'm trying to add commands to my server, but I don't know where to add them. Where do they go?[/iurl] [iurl=#ten]When I run my server it says 'ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException'. How come?[/iurl] [iurl=#eleven]How do I make certain buttons do things?[/iurl] [iurl=#twelve]Where do I find a decent client to use?[/iurl] [iurl=#thirteen]Where can I find a list of decent tutorials?[/iurl] [iurl=#fourteen]When I run my server, the batch reads 'Error unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use?'. Why?[/iurl] [iurl=#fifteen]What's a good compiler code?[/iurl] [iurl=#sixteen]Whenever I compile, it gives me errors![/iurl][/center]
[hr]
[center][u][size=15pt][b]F[/b]requently [b]A[/b]sked [b]Q[/b]uestions[/size][/u][/center]
[hr]
[b]Q[/b] = Question [b]A[/b] = Answer
[hr] [anchor=one][b]Q[/b]: Where can I learn Java? [color=green][b]A[/b]: You can learn Java [url=http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/index.html]here[/url].
[hr] [anchor=two][b]Q[/b]: How do I start my own private server? [color=green][b]A[/b]: Follow [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html]this[/url] tutorial.
[hr]
[anchor=three][b]Q[/b]: How do I port forward? Follow the step in the How to Start a Server tutorial or go to http://portforward.com/.
[hr]
[anchor=four][b]Q[/b]: Where do I download Java? [b]A[/b]: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp - it should be the first one listed.
[hr]
[anchor=five][b]Q[/b]: When I try to compile my Java files, the compiler prints ''javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command'. How do I fix this? [b]A[/b]: To fix this, you'll need to follow these steps: Set your environmental variables. Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java. We will firstly open 'My Computer' and click 'View System Information'. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says 'Advanced' and at the bottom, click 'Environmental Variables'. Now what you're going to do, is go to your 'Path' and 'Classpath' variables and edit them.
In your Classpath variable, you're going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be: [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code] If a newer version of JDK comes out, change the '7' to the newest update.
After you have done the Classpath variable, you're going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it. [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin;[/code]
[color=green]The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you're going to change the '7' to your current JDK update. Once you've done that, you'll need to edit your compiler batch file code to the one below: [code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause[/code] You'll have to change the '7' once again to the JDK update you have downloaded.
Alternatively, you can use [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,375681.0.html]Lin's Environmental Variable Setter[/url].
[hr]
[anchor=six][b]Q[/b]: Where can I find *name here*? [b]A[/b]: Use the [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=search]search feature[/url].
[IMG]http://i771.photobucket.com/albums/xx351/the-soul1/search.jpg[/img]
[hr]
[anchor=seven][b]Q[/b]: How do I change my player rights? [color=green][b]A[/b]: 317 protocol: find your character folder, and where it says 'character-rights = x', change 'x' to the player rights you want to be. 508 protocol: in the login class, search: [code]if (p.username.equals("[/code] above that, add: [code]if (p.username.equals("NAME")) { p.rights = x; }[/code] change 'x' to the player rights.
[hr]
[anchor=eight][b]Q[/b]: What are the most common player rights? [b]A[/b]: 0 - normal player 1 - moderator 2 - administrator
[hr]
[anchor=nine][b]Q[/b]: I'm trying to add commands to my server, but I don't know where to add them. Where do they go? [b]A[/b]: The customCommand() method in client class. Search 'customCommand(String command)' and place your command under the method.
[hr]
[anchor=ten][b]Q[/b]: When I run my server it says 'ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException'. How come? [b]A[/b]: The index you have entered in some file (the run console will show which file and which line) is either negative or greater than or equal to the size of the array.
[hr]
[anchor=eleven][b]Q[/b]: How do I make certain buttons do things? [b]A[/b]: It's called an action button, and it's handled in the clicking most packet (packet 185). The case label is used as the button's ID, and the code under it will be used to determine what happens when the button is clicked. (for more packets and their payload go [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,413688.0.html]here[/url]).
[hr]
[anchor=twelve][b]Q[/b]: Where do I find a decent client to use? [b]A[/b]: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,6915.0/topicseen.html
[hr]
[anchor=thirteen][b]Q[/b]: Where can I find a list of decent tutorials? [b]A[/b]: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,463977.0.html
[hr]
[anchor=fourteen][color=red][b]Q[/b]: When I run my server, the batch reads 'Error unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use?'. Why? [color=green][b]A[/b]: It's because there's another program occupying the port 43594 already. You need to terminate the connection.
[hr]
[anchor=fifteen][b]Q[/b]: What's a good compiler code? [color=green][b]A[/b]: From Taharok: [code]@echo off @title Perfect Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code] Remember that if this does not work, you must download java.
[hr]
[anchor=sixteen][b]Q[/b]: Whenever I compile, it gives me errors! [color=green][b]A[/b]: Any compile error(s) can be solved using [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html]this[/url] topic, by deathschaos9. And if it's not there, feel free to ask in [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,349078.0.html]this[/url] topic. And if no one helps, please use Google.
[hr]
This will be updated more when different questions are asked frequently.

item.title: MoparScape Server Help FAQ [Please read Before Posting]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:21, topic:370047”]There is no such thing as a “good compiler”. Taharok’s “perfect compiler” basically checks if you have Javac installed before compiling, otherwise it will return a message.[/quote]Well then, it can be known as a “proper compiler”

Read full topic
item.source: MoparScape Server Help FAQ [Please read Before Posting]

item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

There is no such thing as a “good compiler”. Taharok’s “perfect compiler” basically checks if you have Javac installed before compiling, otherwise it will return a message.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Server Help FAQ [Please read Before Posting]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:18, topic:370047”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=466161.msg3409161#msg3409161 date=1290545573]
[anchor=ten]Q: When I run my server it says ‘ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException’. How come?
A: This is most likely caused due to a configuration file. Always use tabs in configuration files, not spaces.
[/quote]

That would throw NumberformatException :p.
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, The index is either negative or greater than or equal to the size of the array.
http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.html[/quote]Oh

[quote=“I Vain I”]Most of that stuff would only work for winterLove bases, such as Czar; Delta, and AllStar.
Thus, creating more room for questions on other protocols / bases, such as Hyperion, Project Insanity, BattleScape, and others.[/quote]I don’t know much about those bases, but then posting the help the person needs would then be required.

Read full topic

That would throw NumberformatException :p.
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, The index is either negative or greater than or equal to the size of the array.
http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.html

item.title: MoparScape Server Help FAQ [Please read Before Posting]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[center]
As of this date [Nov. 23, 2010], most of the FAQ is from The_Soul so many thanks to him. This topic will be updated much more when different frequent questions have been asked in this Server Help section. The purpose of this is to stop users from repeating questions that have been answered many times before and instead of them waiting for an answer, they could just look here for the answer. [/center]

[hr]

[center][size=15pt]Table of Contents[/size][/center]

[hr]

[center][iurl=#one]Where can I learn Java?[/iurl]
[iurl=#two]How do I start my own private server?[/iurl]
[iurl=#three]How do I port forward?[/iurl]
[iurl=#four]Where do I download java?[/iurl]
[iurl=#five]When I try to compile my Java files, the compiler prints ‘‘javac’ is not recognized as an internal or external command’. How do I fix this?[/iurl]
[iurl=#six]Where can I find name here?[/iurl]
[iurl=#seven]How do I change my player rights?[/iurl]
[iurl=#eight]What are the most common player rights?[/iurl]
[iurl=#nine]I’m trying to add commands to my server, but I don’t know where to add them. Where do they go?[/iurl]
[iurl=#ten]When I run my server it says ‘ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException’. How come?[/iurl]
[iurl=#eleven]How do I make certain buttons do things?[/iurl]
[iurl=#twelve]Where do I find a decent client to use?[/iurl]
[iurl=#thirteen]Where can I find a list of decent tutorials?[/iurl]
[iurl=#fourteen]When I run my server, the batch reads ‘Error unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use?’. Why?[/iurl]
[iurl=#fifteen]What’s a good compiler code?[/iurl]
[iurl=#sixteen]Whenever I compile, it gives me errors![/iurl][/center]

[hr]

[center][size=15pt]Frequently Asked Questions[/size][/center]

[hr]

Q = Question
A = Answer

[hr]
[anchor=one]Q: Where can I learn Java?
[color=green]A: You can learn Java here.

[hr]
[anchor=two]Q: How do I start my own private server?
[color=green]A: Follow this tutorial.

[hr]

[anchor=three]Q: How do I port forward?
Follow the step in the How to Start a Server tutorial or go to http://portforward.com/.

[hr]

[anchor=four]Q: Where do I download Java?
A: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp - it should be the first one listed.

[hr]

[anchor=five]Q: When I try to compile my Java files, the compiler prints ‘‘javac’ is not recognized as an internal or external command’. How do I fix this?
A: To fix this, you’ll need to follow these steps:
Set your environmental variables. Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java. We will firstly open ‘My Computer’ and click ‘View System Information’. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says ‘Advanced’ and at the bottom, click ‘Environmental Variables’. Now what you’re going to do, is go to your ‘Path’ and ‘Classpath’ variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you’re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

If a newer version of JDK comes out, change the ‘7’ to the newest update.

After you have done the Classpath variable, you’re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_7\bin;

[color=green]The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you’re going to change the ‘7’ to your current JDK update. Once you’ve done that, you’ll need to edit your compiler batch file code to the one below:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
You’ll have to change the ‘7’ once again to the JDK update you have downloaded.

Alternatively, you can use Lin’s Environmental Variable Setter.

[hr]

[anchor=six]Q: Where can I find name here?
A: Use the search feature.

[hr]

[anchor=seven]Q: How do I change my player rights?
[color=green]A:
317 protocol: find your character folder, and where it says ‘character-rights = x’, change ‘x’ to the player rights you want to be.
508 protocol: in the login class, search:

if (p.username.equals("

above that, add:

if (p.username.equals("NAME")) { p.rights = x; }
change ‘x’ to the player rights.

[hr]

[anchor=eight]Q: What are the most common player rights?
A:
0 - normal player
1 - moderator
2 - administrator

[hr]

[anchor=nine]Q: I’m trying to add commands to my server, but I don’t know where to add them. Where do they go?
A: The customCommand() method in client class. Search ‘customCommand(String command)’ and place your command under the method.

[hr]

[anchor=ten]Q: When I run my server it says ‘ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException’. How come?
A: The index you have entered in some file (the run console will show which file and which line) is either negative or greater than or equal to the size of the array.

[hr]

[anchor=eleven]Q: How do I make certain buttons do things?
A: It’s called an action button, and it’s handled in the clicking most packet (packet 185). The case label is used as the button’s ID, and the code under it will be used to determine what happens when the button is clicked. (for more packets and their payload go here).

[hr]

[anchor=twelve]Q: Where do I find a decent client to use?
A: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,6915.0/topicseen.html

[hr]

[anchor=thirteen]Q: Where can I find a list of decent tutorials?
A: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,463977.0.html

[hr]

[anchor=fourteen][color=red]Q: When I run my server, the batch reads ‘Error unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use?’. Why?
[color=green]A: It’s because there’s another program occupying the port 43594 already. You need to terminate the connection.

[hr]

[anchor=fifteen]Q: What’s a good compiler code?
[color=green]A: From Taharok: @echo off @title Perfect Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit Remember that if this does not work, you must download java.

[hr]

[anchor=sixteen]Q: Whenever I compile, it gives me errors!
[color=green]A: Any compile error(s) can be solved using this topic, by deathschaos9. And if it’s not there, feel free to ask in this topic. And if no one helps, please use Google.

[hr]

This will be updated more when different questions are asked frequently.

Read full topic
item.source: MoparScape Server Help FAQ [Please read Before Posting]
